Description: Fragment of floor of East Dorian pottery plate. Two registers preserved separated by key meander between lines; outside, a dog to right; to the centre, the head of a sphinx, also to right. The surface is very worn. The underside is reserved, with concentric grooves.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The dog in the outer frieze is an early feature (Cook GPP, p.119; Kardara, pp.148-49).
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 21, no. 68 pl. 18)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.914)
